blocks.name: axprlem1
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ axpr . The set of all empty sets exists. (Contributed by Rohan Ridenour, 10-Aug-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm axprlem1(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  |- wex(s0, wal(s1, wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wal(s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
} = {
  bm1.3ii(s0, s1, wal(s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))))
  exlimiiv(hs0, wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wal(s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), wal(s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))))
  mpbii(wal(s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))), wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wal(s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wal(s2, wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))
  ax-pow(s0, s1, s2, hs0)
  exbidv(s0, wal(s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))), wal(s1, wi(wal(s2, wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wal(s1, wi(wal(s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  albidv(s1, wal(s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))), wi(wal(s2, wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wi(wal(s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  imbi1d(wal(s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))), wal(s2, wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wal(s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))))
  albid(s2, wal(s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))), wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0))), wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1))))
  nfa1(s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0))))
  sps(s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0))), wb(wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0))), wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))))
  imnot(wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))
  ax-nul(hs0, s2)
  diff.wal.s(s0, s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1))))
  diff.wn.s(s0, wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(s2), cv(s1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.hs0.w(wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wal(s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))
  diffss.ex(s2, hs0)
  diff.wal.s(s0, s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0))))
  diff.wn.s(s0, wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(s2), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wal.s(s1, s2, wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0))))
  diff.wn.s(s1, wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, cv(s2), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)

thm axprlem1(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  ⊢ ∃(s0, ∀(s1,(s1 ∈ s0 ↔ ∀(s2, ¬ s2 ∈ s1))))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
} = {
  bm1.3ii(s0, s1, ∀(s2, ¬ s2 ∈ s1))
  exlimiiv(hs0, ∃(s0, ∀(s1,(∀(s2, ¬ s2 ∈ s1)→ s1 ∈ s0))), ∀(s2, ¬ s2 ∈ hs0))
  mpbii(∀(s2, ¬ s2 ∈ hs0), ∃(s0, ∀(s1,(∀(s2, ¬ s2 ∈ s1)→ s1 ∈ s0))), ∃(s0, ∀(s1,(∀(s2,(s2 ∈ s1 → s2 ∈ hs0))→ s1 ∈ s0))))
  ax-pow(s0, s1, s2, hs0)
  exbidv(s0, ∀(s2, ¬ s2 ∈ hs0), ∀(s1,(∀(s2,(s2 ∈ s1 → s2 ∈ hs0))→ s1 ∈ s0)), ∀(s1,(∀(s2, ¬ s2 ∈ s1)→ s1 ∈ s0)))
  albidv(s1, ∀(s2, ¬ s2 ∈ hs0), (∀(s2,(s2 ∈ s1 → s2 ∈ hs0))→ s1 ∈ s0), (∀(s2, ¬ s2 ∈ s1)→ s1 ∈ s0))
  imbi1d(∀(s2, ¬ s2 ∈ hs0), ∀(s2,(s2 ∈ s1 → s2 ∈ hs0)), s1 ∈ s0, ∀(s2, ¬ s2 ∈ s1))
  albid(s2, ∀(s2, ¬ s2 ∈ hs0), (s2 ∈ s1 → s2 ∈ hs0), ¬ s2 ∈ s1)
  nfa1(s2, ¬ s2 ∈ hs0)
  sps(s2, ¬ s2 ∈ hs0, ((s2 ∈ s1 → s2 ∈ hs0)↔ ¬ s2 ∈ s1))
  imnot(s2 ∈ hs0, s2 ∈ s1)
  ax-nul(hs0, s2)
  diff.wal.s(s0, s2, ¬ s2 ∈ s1)
  diff.wn.s(s0, s2 ∈ s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, s2, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.hs0.w(∃(s0, ∀(s1,(∀(s2, ¬ s2 ∈ s1)→ s1 ∈ s0))))
  diffss.ex(s2, hs0)
  diff.wal.s(s0, s2, ¬ s2 ∈ hs0)
  diff.wn.s(s0, s2 ∈ hs0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, s2, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wal.s(s1, s2, ¬ s2 ∈ hs0)
  diff.wn.s(s1, s2 ∈ hs0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, s2, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
}

  syl6bbr(wal(s2, wb(wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0)), wal(s3, wn(wcel(cv(s3), cv(s2)))))), wal(s2, wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))), wral(s2, cv(s1), wal(s3, wn(wcel(cv(s3), cv(s2))))), wal(s2, wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wal(s3, wn(wcel(cv(s3), cv(s2)))))))

thm axpr(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ⊢ ∃(s0, ∀(s1,((s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3)→ s1 ∈ s0)))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, s3)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s3)
} = {
  eximii(s0, ∀(s1,((s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3)→ s1 ∈ s0)), ∀(s1,(s1 ∈ s0 ↔(s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3))))
  exlimiiv(hs1, ∃(s0, ∀(s1,(s1 ∈ s0 ↔(s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3)))), ∀(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ↔ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs0, ∀(hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3)))))
  mpbii(∀(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ↔ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs0, ∀(hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3)))), ∃(s0, ∀(s1,(s1 ∈ s0 ↔(s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3)))), ∃(s0, ∀(s1,(s1 ∈ s0 ↔ ∃(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ∧ if(∃(hs3, hs3 ∈ hs0), s1 = s2, s1 = s3)))))))
  axprlem3(s0, s1, hs0, hs1, hs3, s2, s3)
  exbidv(s0, ∀(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ↔ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs0, ∀(hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3)))), ∀(s1,(s1 ∈ s0 ↔ ∃(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ∧ if(∃(hs3, hs3 ∈ hs0), s1 = s2, s1 = s3))))), ∀(s1,(s1 ∈ s0 ↔(s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3))))
  albidv(s1, ∀(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ↔ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs0, ∀(hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3)))), (s1 ∈ s0 ↔ ∃(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ∧ if(∃(hs3, hs3 ∈ hs0), s1 = s2, s1 = s3)))), (s1 ∈ s0 ↔(s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3)))
  bibi2d(∀(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ↔ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs0, ∀(hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3)))), s1 ∈ s0, ∃(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ∧ if(∃(hs3, hs3 ∈ hs0), s1 = s2, s1 = s3))), (s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3))
  impbid(∀(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ↔ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs0, ∀(hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3)))), ∃(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ∧ if(∃(hs3, hs3 ∈ hs0), s1 = s2, s1 = s3))), (s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3))
  com12(∀(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ↔ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs0, ∀(hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3)))), ∃(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ∧ if(∃(hs3, hs3 ∈ hs0), s1 = s2, s1 = s3))), (s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3))
  exlimi(hs0, (hs0 ∈ hs1 ∧ if(∃(hs3, hs3 ∈ hs0), s1 = s2, s1 = s3)), (∀(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ↔ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs0, ∀(hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3))))→(s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3)))
  nfim(hs0, ∀(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ↔ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs0, ∀(hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3)))), (s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3))
  nfa1(hs0, (hs0 ∈ hs1 ↔ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs0, ∀(hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3))))
  nfor(hs0, s1 = s2, s1 = s3)
  nfv(hs0, s1 = s2)
  nfv(hs0, s1 = s3)
  a1d((hs0 ∈ hs1 ∧ if(∃(hs3, hs3 ∈ hs0), s1 = s2, s1 = s3)), ∀(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ↔ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs0, ∀(hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3)))), (s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3))
  adantl(hs0 ∈ hs1, if(∃(hs3, hs3 ∈ hs0), s1 = s2, s1 = s3), (s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3))
  ifpor(∃(hs3, hs3 ∈ hs0), s1 = s2, s1 = s3)
  ex(∀(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ↔ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs0, ∀(hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3)))), (s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3), ∃(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ∧ if(∃(hs3, hs3 ∈ hs0), s1 = s2, s1 = s3))))
  jaodan(∀(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ↔ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs0, ∀(hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3)))), s1 = s2, s1 = s3, ∃(hs0,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ∧ if(∃(hs3, hs3 ∈ hs0), s1 = s2, s1 = s3))))
  axprlem4(hs0, hs1, hs3, hs2, s1, s2, s3)
  axprlem5(hs0, hs1, hs3, hs2, s1, s3, s2)
  axprlem2(hs1, hs0, hs3, hs2)
  alimi(s1, (s1 ∈ s0 ↔(s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3)), ((s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3)→ s1 ∈ s0))
  biimpr(s1 ∈ s0, (s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3))
  diff.hs1.w(∃(s0, ∀(s1,(s1 ∈ s0 ↔(s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3)))))

  diff.wal.s(s0, hs0, (hs0 ∈ hs1 ↔ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs0, ∀(hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3))))

  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wal.s(s0, hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3)
  diff.wn.s(s0, hs2 ∈ hs3)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, hs2, hs3)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs2)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs2)
  diff.hs2.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs3)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs3)
  diff.hs3.s(s0)
  diff.wal.s(s1, hs0, (hs0 ∈ hs1 ↔ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs0, ∀(hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3))))
  diff.wb.s(s1, hs0 ∈ hs1, ∀(hs3 ∈ hs0, ∀(hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3)))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, hs0, hs1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s1)
  diff.wral.s(s1, hs3, hs0, ∀(hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3))
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.wal.s(s1, hs2, ¬ hs2 ∈ hs3)
  diff.wn.s(s1, hs2 ∈ hs3)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, hs2, hs3)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs2)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs2)
  diff.hs2.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs3)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs3)
  diff.hs3.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(s1 = s2)
  diff.hs0.w(s1 = s3)
  diff.hs0.s(hs3)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diff.hs3.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.s(s3)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.s(hs3)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
}

blocks.name: ax-pr
blocks.content: The Axiom of Pairing of ZF set theory. It was derived as theorem ~ axpr above and is therefore redundant, but we state it as a separate axiom here so that its uses can be identified more easily. (Contributed by NM, 14-Nov-2006.)
blocks.origin:
axiom ax-pr(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wo(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s3))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
}

axiom ax-pr(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ⊢ ∃(s0, ∀(s1,((s1 = s2 ∨ s1 = s3)→ s1 ∈ s0)))
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s3)
  ⊣ d(s0, s3)
}

blocks.content: Derive the abbreviated version of the Axiom of Pairing from ~ ax-pr . See ~ zfpair for its derivation from the other axioms. (Contributed by NM, 14-Nov-2006.)

thm zfpair2(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  |- wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), universe)
} = {
  issetri(hs0, cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  mpbir(wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wex(hs0, wal(hs1, wb(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), wo(wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s1)))))))
  bm1.3ii(hs0, hs1, wo(wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s1))))
  ax-pr(hs0, hs1, s0, s1)
  exbii(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(hs1, wb(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), wo(wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s1))))))
  bitri(wceq(cv(hs0), cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(hs1, wb(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), wo(wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s1))))), wal(hs1, wb(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs1), cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
  dfcleq(hs1, cv(hs0), cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  albii(hs1, wb(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs1), cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wb(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), wo(wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s1)))))
  bibi2i(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs1), cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wo(wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s1))))
  elpr(cv(hs1), cv(s0), cv(s1))
  vex(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.w(wo(wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s1))))
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs1.c(cv(hs0))
  diff.hs1.c(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
}

thm zfpair2(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  ⊢ { s0, s1 } ∈ 𝕌
} = {
  issetri(hs0, { s0, s1 })
  mpbir(∃(hs0, hs0 = { s0, s1 }), ∃(hs0, ∀(hs1,(hs1 ∈ hs0 ↔(hs1 = s0 ∨ hs1 = s1)))))
  bm1.3ii(hs0, hs1, (hs1 = s0 ∨ hs1 = s1))
  ax-pr(hs0, hs1, s0, s1)
  exbii(hs0, hs0 = { s0, s1 }, ∀(hs1,(hs1 ∈ hs0 ↔(hs1 = s0 ∨ hs1 = s1))))
  bitri(hs0 = { s0, s1 }, ∀(hs1,(hs1 ∈ hs0 ↔(hs1 = s0 ∨ hs1 = s1))), ∀(hs1,(hs1 ∈ hs0 ↔ hs1 ∈ { s0, s1 })))
  dfcleq(hs1, hs0, { s0, s1 })
  albii(hs1, (hs1 ∈ hs0 ↔ hs1 ∈ { s0, s1 }), (hs1 ∈ hs0 ↔(hs1 = s0 ∨ hs1 = s1)))
  bibi2i(hs1 ∈ hs0, hs1 ∈ { s0, s1 }, (hs1 = s0 ∨ hs1 = s1))
  elpr(hs1, s0, s1)
  vex(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c({ s0, s1 })
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.w((hs1 = s0 ∨ hs1 = s1))
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs1.c(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c({ s0, s1 })
}

blocks.name: snex
blocks.content: A singleton is a set. Theorem 7.12 of [Quine] p. 51, proved using Extensionality, Separation, Null Set, and Pairing. See also ~ snexALT . (Contributed by NM, 7-Aug-1994.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-May-2013.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm snex(class c0) {
  |- wcel(csn(c0), universe)
} = {
  pm2.61i(wcel(csn(c0), universe), wcel(c0, universe))
  syl5eqel(csn(c0), universe, cpr(c0, c0), wcel(c0, universe))
  dfsn2(c0)
  vtoclg(hs0, c0, universe, wcel(cpr(c0, c0), universe), wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), universe))
  eleq1d(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), universe, cpr(c0, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  anidms(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), cpr(c0, c0)))
  preq12(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs0), c0)
  zfpair2(hs0, hs0)
  syl6eqel(csn(c0), universe, emptycls, wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  biimpi(wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wceq(csn(c0), emptycls))
  snprc(c0)
  0ex()
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cpr(c0, c0), universe))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm snex(class c0) {
  ⊢ { c0 } ∈ 𝕌
} = {
  pm2.61i({ c0 } ∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  syl5eqel({ c0 }, universe, { c0, c0 }, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  dfsn2(c0)
  vtoclg(hs0, c0, universe, { c0, c0 } ∈ 𝕌, { hs0, hs0 } ∈ 𝕌)
  eleq1d({ hs0, hs0 }, universe, { c0, c0 }, hs0 = c0)
  anidms(hs0 = c0, { hs0, hs0 } = { c0, c0 })
  preq12(hs0, c0, hs0, c0)
  zfpair2(hs0, hs0)
  syl6eqel({ c0 }, universe, emptycls, ¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  biimpi(¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌, { c0 } = ∅)
  snprc(c0)
  0ex()
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w({ c0, c0 } ∈ 𝕌)
}

blocks.name: prex
blocks.content: The Axiom of Pairing using class variables. Theorem 7.13 of [Quine] p. 51. By virtue of its definition, an unordered pair remains a set (even though no longer a pair) even when its components are proper classes (see ~ prprc ), so we can dispense with hypotheses requiring them to be sets. (Contributed by NM, 15-Jul-1993.)
blocks.origin:
thm prex(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wcel(cpr(c0, c1), universe)
} = {
  pm2.61nii(wcel(cpr(c0, c1), universe), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe))
  vtocleg(hs0, c0, universe, wi(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(cpr(c0, c1), universe)))
  syl5ib(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(cpr(c0, c1), universe), wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), c1), universe))
  vtoclg(hs1, c1, universe, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), c1), universe), wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), universe))
  eleq1d(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), universe, cpr(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cv(hs1), c1))
  preq2(cv(hs1), c1, cv(hs0))
  zfpair2(hs0, hs1)
  eleq1d(cpr(cv(hs0), c1), universe, cpr(c0, c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  preq1(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  syl6eqel(cpr(c0, c1), universe, csn(c1), wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  prprc1(c0, c1)
  snex(c1)
  syl6eqel(cpr(c0, c1), universe, csn(c0), wn(wcel(c1, universe)))
  prprc2(c1, c0)
  snex(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wi(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(cpr(c0, c1), universe)))
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), c1), universe))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm prex(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ { c0, c1 } ∈ 𝕌
} = {
  pm2.61nii({ c0, c1 } ∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ 𝕌, c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  vtocleg(hs0, c0, universe, (c1 ∈ 𝕌 → { c0, c1 } ∈ 𝕌))
  syl5ib(hs0 = c0, c1 ∈ 𝕌, { c0, c1 } ∈ 𝕌, { hs0, c1 } ∈ 𝕌)
  vtoclg(hs1, c1, universe, { hs0, c1 } ∈ 𝕌, { hs0, hs1 } ∈ 𝕌)
  eleq1d({ hs0, hs1 }, universe, { hs0, c1 }, hs1 = c1)
  preq2(hs1, c1, hs0)
  zfpair2(hs0, hs1)
  eleq1d({ hs0, c1 }, universe, { c0, c1 }, hs0 = c0)
  preq1(hs0, c0, c1)
  syl6eqel({ c0, c1 }, universe, { c1 }, ¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  prprc1(c0, c1)
  snex(c1)
  syl6eqel({ c0, c1 }, universe, { c0 }, ¬ c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  prprc2(c1, c0)
  snex(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w((c1 ∈ 𝕌 → { c0, c1 } ∈ 𝕌))
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.w({ hs0, c1 } ∈ 𝕌)
}

blocks.name: elALT
blocks.content: Alternate proof of ~ el , shorter but requiring more axioms. (Contributed by NM, 4-Jan-2002.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm elALT(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  |- wex(s0, wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  ax-mp(wex(s0, wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wcel(cv(s1), csn(cv(s1))))
  snid(cv(s1))
  vex(s1)
  spcev(s0, csn(cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s1), csn(cv(s1))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  snex(cv(s1))
  eleq2(cv(s0), csn(cv(s1)), cv(s1))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(s1), csn(cv(s1)))
  diff.csn.s(s0, cv(s1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm elALT(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  ⊢ ∃(s0, s1 ∈ s0)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
} = {
  ax-mp(∃(s0, s1 ∈ s0), s1 ∈ { s1 })
  snid(s1)
  vex(s1)
  spcev(s0, { s1 }, s1 ∈ { s1 }, s1 ∈ s0)
  snex(s1)
  eleq2(s0, { s1 }, s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, s1, { s1 })
  diff.csn.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
}

blocks.name: dtruALT2
blocks.content: Alternate proof of ~ dtru using ~ ax-pr instead of ~ ax-pow . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm dtruALT2(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  |- wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  mpbi(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wex(s0, wn(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  pm2.61i(wex(s0, wn(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wceq(cv(s1), emptycls))
  syl(wceq(cv(s1), emptycls), wex(s0, wn(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wn(wceq(cv(s1), csn(emptycls))))
  0inp0(cv(s1))
  spcev(s0, csn(emptycls), wn(wceq(cv(s1), csn(emptycls))), wn(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  snex(emptycls)
  notbid(wceq(cv(s0), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s1), csn(emptycls)))
  eqeq2(cv(s0), csn(emptycls), cv(s1))
  spcev(s0, emptycls, wn(wceq(cv(s1), emptycls)), wn(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  0ex()
  notbid(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s1), emptycls))
  eqeq2(cv(s0), emptycls, cv(s1))
  xchbinx(wex(s0, wn(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  exnal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  albii(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  eqcom(cv(s1), cv(s0))
  diff.wn.s(s0, wceq(cv(s1), csn(emptycls)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(s1), csn(emptycls))
  diff.csn.s(s0, emptycls)
  diff.wn.s(s0, wceq(cv(s1), emptycls))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(s1), emptycls)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm dtruALT2(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  ⊢ ¬ ∀(s0, s0 = s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
} = {
  mpbi(¬ ∀(s0, s0 = s1), ∃(s0, ¬ s1 = s0))
  pm2.61i(∃(s0, ¬ s1 = s0), s1 = ∅)
  syl(s1 = ∅, ∃(s0, ¬ s1 = s0), ¬ s1 = { ∅ })
  0inp0(s1)
  spcev(s0, { ∅ }, ¬ s1 = { ∅ }, ¬ s1 = s0)
  snex(emptycls)
  notbid(s0 = { ∅ }, s1 = s0, s1 = { ∅ })
  eqeq2(s0, { ∅ }, s1)
  spcev(s0, emptycls, ¬ s1 = ∅, ¬ s1 = s0)
  0ex()
  notbid(s0 = ∅, s1 = s0, s1 = ∅)
  eqeq2(s0, emptycls, s1)
  xchbinx(∃(s0, ¬ s1 = s0), ∀(s0, s0 = s1), ∀(s0, s1 = s0))
  exnal(s0, s1 = s0)
  albii(s0, s1 = s0, s0 = s1)
  eqcom(s1, s0)
  diff.wn.s(s0, s1 = { ∅ })
  diff.wceq.s(s0, s1, { ∅ })
  diff.csn.s(s0, emptycls)
  diff.wn.s(s0, s1 = ∅)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, s1, emptycls)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: snelpwi

blocks.name: snelpw
blocks.content: A singleton of a set belongs to the power class of a class containing the set. (Contributed by NM, 1-Apr-1998.)

blocks.name: prelpw
blocks.content: A pair of two sets belongs to the power class of a class containing those two sets and vice versa. (Contributed by AV, 8-Jan-2020.)

blocks.name: prelpwi
blocks.content: A pair of two sets belongs to the power class of a class containing those two sets. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 10-Mar-2017.) (Proof shortened by AV, 23-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: rext
blocks.content: A theorem similar to extensionality, requiring the existence of a singleton. Exercise 8 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 16. (Contributed by NM, 10-Aug-1993.)
blocks.origin:
thm rext(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  |- wi(wal(s0, wi(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)))), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wal(s0, wi(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)))), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))), diffss(s1, s2))
  syl(wal(s0, wi(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)))), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s2), csn(cv(s1))))
  mpi(wal(s0, wi(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)))), wcel(cv(s2), csn(cv(s1))), wcel(cv(s1), csn(cv(s1))))
  vsnid(s1)
  spcv(s0, csn(cv(s1)), wi(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0))), wi(wcel(cv(s1), csn(cv(s1))), wcel(cv(s2), csn(cv(s1)))))
  snex(cv(s1))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), csn(cv(s1))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s1), csn(cv(s1))), wcel(cv(s2), csn(cv(s1))))
  eleq2(cv(s0), csn(cv(s1)), cv(s1))
  eleq2(cv(s0), csn(cv(s1)), cv(s2))
  sylbi(wcel(cv(s2), csn(cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)))
  velsn(s2, cv(s1))
  equcomi(s2, s1)
  diff.wi.s(s0, wcel(cv(s1), csn(cv(s1))), wcel(cv(s2), csn(cv(s1))))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(s1), csn(cv(s1)))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(s2), csn(cv(s1)))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
  diff.csn.s(s0, cv(s1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm rext(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  ⊢ (∀(s0,(s1 ∈ s0 → s2 ∈ s0))→ s1 = s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
} = {
  a1ii((∀(s0,(s1 ∈ s0 → s2 ∈ s0))→ s1 = s2), d(s1, s2))
  syl(∀(s0,(s1 ∈ s0 → s2 ∈ s0)), s1 = s2, s2 ∈ { s1 })
  mpi(∀(s0,(s1 ∈ s0 → s2 ∈ s0)), s2 ∈ { s1 }, s1 ∈ { s1 })
  vsnid(s1)
  spcv(s0, { s1 }, (s1 ∈ s0 → s2 ∈ s0), (s1 ∈ { s1 } → s2 ∈ { s1 }))
  snex(s1)
  imbi12d(s0 = { s1 }, s1 ∈ s0, s2 ∈ s0, s1 ∈ { s1 }, s2 ∈ { s1 })
  eleq2(s0, { s1 }, s1)
  eleq2(s0, { s1 }, s2)
  sylbi(s2 ∈ { s1 }, s1 = s2, s2 = s1)
  velsn(s2, s1)
  equcomi(s2, s1)
  diff.wi.s(s0, s1 ∈ { s1 }, s2 ∈ { s1 })
  diff.wcel.s(s0, s1, { s1 })
  diff.wcel.s(s0, s2, { s1 })
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
  diff.csn.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
}

blocks.name: sspwb
blocks.content: The powerclass construction preserves and reflects inclusion. Classes are subclasses if and only if their power classes are subclasses. Exercise 18 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 18. (Contributed by NM, 13-Oct-1996.)
blocks.origin:
thm sspwb(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wb(wss(c0, c1), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)))
} = {
  impbii(wss(c0, c1), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)))
  ssrdv(hs0, cpw(c0), cpw(c1), wss(c0, c1))
  3imtr4g(wss(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)), wss(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cv(hs0), c1))
  com12(wss(c0, c1), wss(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cv(hs0), c1))
  sstr2(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  elpw(cv(hs0), c0)
  elpw(cv(hs0), c1)
  ssrdv(hs0, c0, c1, wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)))
  3imtr3g(wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cpw(c0)), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cpw(c1)))
  ssel(cpw(c0), cpw(c1), csn(cv(hs0)))
  bitr4i(wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wss(csn(cv(hs0)), c0))
  elpw(csn(cv(hs0)), c0)
  snss(cv(hs0), c0)
  bitr4i(wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cpw(c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wss(csn(cv(hs0)), c1))
  elpw(csn(cv(hs0)), c1)
  snex(cv(hs0))
  snss(cv(hs0), c1)
  vex(hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(c0))
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(c1))
  diff.hs0.w(wss(c0, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sspwb(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ⊆ c1 ↔ P(c0)⊆ P(c1))
} = {
  impbii(c0 ⊆ c1, P(c0)⊆ P(c1))
  ssrdv(hs0, P(c0), P(c1), c0 ⊆ c1)
  3imtr4g(c0 ⊆ c1, hs0 ∈ P(c0), hs0 ∈ P(c1), hs0 ⊆ c0, hs0 ⊆ c1)
  com12(c0 ⊆ c1, hs0 ⊆ c0, hs0 ⊆ c1)
  sstr2(hs0, c0, c1)
  elpw(hs0, c0)
  elpw(hs0, c1)
  ssrdv(hs0, c0, c1, P(c0)⊆ P(c1))
  3imtr3g(P(c0)⊆ P(c1), hs0 ∈ c0, hs0 ∈ c1, { hs0 } ∈ P(c0), { hs0 } ∈ P(c1))
  ssel(P(c0), P(c1), { hs0 })
  bitr4i({ hs0 } ∈ P(c0), hs0 ∈ c0, { hs0 } ⊆ c0)
  elpw({ hs0 }, c0)
  snss(hs0, c0)
  bitr4i({ hs0 } ∈ P(c1), hs0 ∈ c1, { hs0 } ⊆ c1)
  elpw({ hs0 }, c1)
  snex(hs0)
  snss(hs0, c1)
  vex(hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(P(c0))
  diff.hs0.c(P(c1))
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ⊆ c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(P(c0)⊆ P(c1))
}

blocks.name: unipw
blocks.content: A class equals the union of its power class. Exercise 6(a) of [Enderton] p. 38. (Contributed by NM, 14-Oct-1996.) (Proof shortened by Alan Sare, 28-Dec-2008.)
blocks.origin:
thm unipw(class c0) {
  |- wceq(cuni(cpw(c0)), c0)
} = {
  eqriv(hs0, cuni(cpw(c0)), c0)
  impbii(wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(cpw(c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c0))
  sylbi(wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(cpw(c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wex(hs1, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), cpw(c0)))))
  eluni(hs1, cv(hs0), cpw(c0))
  exlimiv(hs1, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), cpw(c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c0))
  elelpwi(cv(hs0), cv(hs1), c0)
  sylancr(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(cpw(c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), csn(cv(hs0))), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cpw(c0)))
  vsnid(hs0)
  snelpwi(cv(hs0), c0)
  elunii(cv(hs0), csn(cv(hs0)), cpw(c0))
  diff.hs0.c(cuni(cpw(c0)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cv(hs0))
  diff.hs1.c(cpw(c0))
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(cv(hs0), c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm unipw(class c0) {
  ⊢ ⋃ P(c0)= c0
} = {
  eqriv(hs0, ⋃ P(c0), c0)
  impbii(hs0 ∈ ⋃ P(c0), hs0 ∈ c0)
  sylbi(hs0 ∈ ⋃ P(c0), hs0 ∈ c0, ∃(hs1,(hs0 ∈ hs1 ∧ hs1 ∈ P(c0))))
  eluni(hs1, hs0, P(c0))
  exlimiv(hs1, (hs0 ∈ hs1 ∧ hs1 ∈ P(c0)), hs0 ∈ c0)
  elelpwi(hs0, hs1, c0)
  sylancr(hs0 ∈ c0, hs0 ∈ ⋃ P(c0), hs0 ∈ { hs0 }, { hs0 } ∈ P(c0))
  vsnid(hs0)
  snelpwi(hs0, c0)
  elunii(hs0, { hs0 }, P(c0))
  diff.hs0.c(⋃ P(c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c(P(c0))
  diff.hs1.w(hs0 ∈ c0)
}

blocks.content: Membership of a power class. Exercise 10 of [Enderton] p. 26. (Contributed by NM, 13-Jan-2007.)

blocks.name: pwtr
blocks.content: A class is transitive iff its power class is transitive. (Contributed by Alan Sare, 25-Aug-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jun-2014.)

blocks.name: ssextss
blocks.content: An extensionality-like principle defining subclass in terms of subsets. (Contributed by NM, 30-Jun-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm ssextss(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wb(wss(c0, c1), wal(s0, wi(wss(cv(s0), c0), wss(cv(s0), c1))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  3bitri(wss(c0, c1), wal(s0, wi(wss(cv(s0), c0), wss(cv(s0), c1))), wss(cpw(c0), cpw(c1)), wal(s0, wi(wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c1)))))
  sspwb(c0, c1)
  dfss2(s0, cpw(c0), cpw(c1))
  albii(s0, wi(wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c1))), wi(wss(cv(s0), c0), wss(cv(s0), c1)))
  imbi12i(wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c0)), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c1)), wss(cv(s0), c0), wss(cv(s0), c1))
  selpw(s0, c0)
  selpw(s0, c1)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c0)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm ssextss(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ⊆ c1 ↔ ∀(s0,(s0 ⊆ c0 → s0 ⊆ c1)))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  3bitri(c0 ⊆ c1, ∀(s0,(s0 ⊆ c0 → s0 ⊆ c1)), P(c0)⊆ P(c1), ∀(s0,(s0 ∈ P(c0)→ s0 ∈ P(c1))))
  sspwb(c0, c1)
  dfss2(s0, P(c0), P(c1))
  albii(s0, (s0 ∈ P(c0)→ s0 ∈ P(c1)), (s0 ⊆ c0 → s0 ⊆ c1))
  imbi12i(s0 ∈ P(c0), s0 ∈ P(c1), s0 ⊆ c0, s0 ⊆ c1)
  selpw(s0, c0)
  selpw(s0, c1)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c0)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c1)
}

blocks.name: ssext
blocks.content: An extensionality-like principle that uses the subset instead of the membership relation: two classes are equal iff they have the same subsets. (Contributed by NM, 30-Jun-2004.)

blocks.name: nssss
blocks.content: Negation of subclass relationship. Compare ~ nss . (Contributed by NM, 30-Jun-2004.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 25-Jul-2011.)

blocks.name: pweqb
blocks.content: Classes are equal if and only if their power classes are equal. Exercise 19 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 18. (Contributed by NM, 13-Oct-1996.)

blocks.name: intid
blocks.content: The intersection of all sets to which a set belongs is the singleton of that set. (Contributed by NM, 5-Jun-2009.)
blocks.origin:
thm intid(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wceq(cint(cab(s0, wcel(c0, cv(s0)))), csn(c0))
  -| wcel(c0, universe)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  eqssi(cint(cab(s0, wcel(c0, cv(s0)))), csn(c0))
  ax-mp(wss(cint(cab(s0, wcel(c0, cv(s0)))), csn(c0)), wcel(csn(c0), universe))
  snex(c0)
  intmin3(s0, csn(c0), universe, wcel(c0, cv(s0)), wcel(c0, csn(c0)))
  eleq2(cv(s0), csn(c0), c0)
  snid(c0)
  ax-mp(wss(csn(c0), cint(cab(s0, wcel(c0, cv(s0))))), wcel(c0, cint(cab(s0, wcel(c0, cv(s0))))))
  mpgbir(s0, wcel(c0, cint(cab(s0, wcel(c0, cv(s0))))), wi(wcel(c0, cv(s0)), wcel(c0, cv(s0))))
  elintab(s0, c0, wcel(c0, cv(s0)))
  id(wcel(c0, cv(s0)))
  snssi(c0, cint(cab(s0, wcel(c0, cv(s0)))))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, csn(c0))
  diff.csn.s(s0, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm intid(setvar s0, class c0) {
  ⊢ ⋂ { s0 | c0 ∈ s0 } = { c0 }
  ⊣ c0 ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  eqssi(⋂ { s0 | c0 ∈ s0 }, { c0 })
  ax-mp(⋂ { s0 | c0 ∈ s0 } ⊆ { c0 }, { c0 } ∈ 𝕌)
  snex(c0)
  intmin3(s0, { c0 }, universe, c0 ∈ s0, c0 ∈ { c0 })
  eleq2(s0, { c0 }, c0)
  snid(c0)
  ax-mp({ c0 } ⊆ ⋂ { s0 | c0 ∈ s0 }, c0 ∈ ⋂ { s0 | c0 ∈ s0 })
  mpgbir(s0, c0 ∈ ⋂ { s0 | c0 ∈ s0 }, (c0 ∈ s0 → c0 ∈ s0))
  elintab(s0, c0, c0 ∈ s0)
  id(c0 ∈ s0)
  snssi(c0, ⋂ { s0 | c0 ∈ s0 })
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, { c0 })
  diff.csn.s(s0, c0)
}

blocks.name: moabex
blocks.content: "At most one" existence implies a class abstraction exists. (Contributed by NM, 30-Dec-1996.)
blocks.origin:

} = {

  bitri(wss(cab(s0, w0), csn(cv(hs0))), wal(s0, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))), wal(s0, wi(w0, wcel(cv(s0), csn(cv(hs0))))))
  abss(s0, csn(cv(hs0)), w0)
  albii(s0, wi(w0, wcel(cv(s0), csn(cv(hs0)))), wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))))
  imbi2i(w0, wcel(cv(s0), csn(cv(hs0))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  velsn(s0, cv(hs0))
  ssex(cab(s0, w0), csn(cv(hs0)))
  snex(cv(hs0))
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cab(s0, w0), universe))
  diff.csn.s(s0, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

thm moabex(setvar s0, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (∃*(s0, w0)→ { s0 | w0 } ∈ 𝕌)
} = {
  sylbi(∃*(s0, w0), { s0 | w0 } ∈ 𝕌, ∃(hs0, ∀(s0,(w0 → s0 = hs0))))
  df-mo(s0, hs0, w0)
  exlimiv(hs0, ∀(s0,(w0 → s0 = hs0)), { s0 | w0 } ∈ 𝕌)
  sylbir(∀(s0,(w0 → s0 = hs0)), { s0 | w0 } ∈ 𝕌, { s0 | w0 } ⊆ { hs0 })
  bitri({ s0 | w0 } ⊆ { hs0 }, ∀(s0,(w0 → s0 = hs0)), ∀(s0,(w0 → s0 ∈ { hs0 })))
  abss(s0, { hs0 }, w0)
  albii(s0, (w0 → s0 ∈ { hs0 }), (w0 → s0 = hs0))
  imbi2i(w0, s0 ∈ { hs0 }, s0 = hs0)
  velsn(s0, hs0)
  ssex({ s0 | w0 }, { hs0 })
  snex(hs0)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.w({ s0 | w0 } ∈ 𝕌)
  diff.csn.s(s0, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)

blocks.name: rmorabex
blocks.content: Restricted "at most one" existence implies a restricted class abstraction exists. (Contributed by NM, 17-Jun-2017.)

blocks.name: euabex
blocks.content: The abstraction of a wff with existential uniqueness exists. (Contributed by NM, 25-Nov-1994.)

blocks.name: nnullss
blocks.content: A nonempty class (even if proper) has a nonempty subset. (Contributed by NM, 23-Aug-2003.)
blocks.origin:
thm nnullss(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wi(wne(c0, emptycls), wex(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), wne(cv(s0), emptycls))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  sylbi(wne(c0, emptycls), wex(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), wne(cv(s0), emptycls))), wex(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), c0)))
  n0(hs0, c0)
  exlimiv(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wex(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), wne(cv(s0), emptycls))))
  sylbi(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wex(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), wne(cv(s0), emptycls))), wss(csn(cv(hs0)), c0))
  snss(cv(hs0), c0)
  mpan2(wss(csn(cv(hs0)), c0), wex(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), wne(cv(s0), emptycls))), wne(csn(cv(hs0)), emptycls))
  snnz(cv(hs0))
  vex(hs0)
  spcev(s0, csn(cv(hs0)), wa(wss(csn(cv(hs0)), c0), wne(csn(cv(hs0)), emptycls)), wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), wne(cv(s0), emptycls)))
  snex(cv(hs0))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), csn(cv(hs0))), wss(cv(s0), c0), wne(cv(s0), emptycls), wss(csn(cv(hs0)), c0), wne(csn(cv(hs0)), emptycls))
  sseq1(cv(s0), csn(cv(hs0)), c0)
  neeq1(cv(s0), csn(cv(hs0)), emptycls)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wex(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), wne(cv(s0), emptycls))))
  diff.wa.s(s0, wss(csn(cv(hs0)), c0), wne(csn(cv(hs0)), emptycls))
  diff.wss.s(s0, csn(cv(hs0)), c0)
  diff.wne.s(s0, csn(cv(hs0)), emptycls)
  diff.csn.s(s0, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
}

thm nnullss(setvar s0, class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ≠ ∅ → ∃(s0,(s0 ⊆ c0 ∧ s0 ≠ ∅)))

} = {

thm exss(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (∃(s0 ∈ c0, w0)→ ∃(s1,(s1 ⊆ c0 ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ s1, w0))))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  sylbi(∃(s0 ∈ c0, w0), ∃(s1,(s1 ⊆ c0 ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ s1, w0))), ∃(hs0, hs0 ∈ { s0 |(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)}))
  3bitr3i(∃(s0 ∈ c0, w0), ∃(hs0, hs0 ∈ { s0 |(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)}), { s0 ∈ c0 | w0 } ≠ ∅, { s0 |(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)} ≠ ∅)
  neeq1i({ s0 ∈ c0 | w0 }, emptycls, { s0 |(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)})
  df-rab(s0, c0, w0)
  rabn0(s0, c0, w0)
  n0(hs0, { s0 |(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)})
  exlimiv(hs0, hs0 ∈ { s0 |(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)}, ∃(s1,(s1 ⊆ c0 ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ s1, w0))))
  syl2anc(hs0 ∈ { s0 |(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)}, ∃(s1,(s1 ⊆ c0 ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ s1, w0))), { hs0 } ⊆ c0, ∃(s0 ∈ { hs0 }, w0))
  sylbi(hs0 ∈ { s0 |(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)}, { hs0 } ⊆ c0, { hs0 } ⊆ { s0 |(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)})
  snss(hs0, { s0 |(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)})
  vex(hs0)
  mpi({ hs0 } ⊆ { s0 |(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)}, { hs0 } ⊆ c0, { s0 |(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)} ⊆ c0)
  ssab2(s0, c0, w0)
  sstr2({ hs0 }, { s0 |(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)}, c0)
  sylib(hs0 ∈ { s0 |(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)}, ∃(s0 ∈ { hs0 }, w0), { s0 ∈ { hs0 } | w0 } ≠ ∅)
  ne0d({ s0 ∈ { hs0 } | w0 }, hs0, hs0 ∈ { s0 |(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)})
  3imtr4i(hs0 ∈ { s0 |(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)}, hs0 ∈ { s0 ∈ { hs0 } | w0 }, ([hs0 / s0]s0 ∈ c0 ∧[hs0 / s0]w0), ([hs0 / s0]s0 ∈ { hs0 } ∧[hs0 / s0]w0))
  jctil(([hs0 / s0]s0 ∈ c0 ∧[hs0 / s0]w0), [hs0 / s0]s0 ∈ { hs0 }, [hs0 / s0]w0)
  simpr([hs0 / s0]s0 ∈ c0, [hs0 / s0]w0)
  mpbir([hs0 / s0]s0 ∈ { hs0 }, [hs0 / s0]s0 = hs0)
  equsb1v(hs0, s0)
  sbbii(hs0, s0, s0 ∈ { hs0 }, s0 = hs0)
  velsn(s0, hs0)
  bitri(hs0 ∈ { s0 |(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)}, ([hs0 / s0]s0 ∈ c0 ∧[hs0 / s0]w0), [hs0 / s0](s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0))
  df-clab(hs0, s0, (s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0))
  sban(hs0, s0, s0 ∈ c0, w0)
  3bitri(hs0 ∈ { s0 ∈ { hs0 } | w0 }, ([hs0 / s0]s0 ∈ { hs0 } ∧[hs0 / s0]w0), hs0 ∈ { s0 |(s0 ∈ { hs0 } ∧ w0)}, [hs0 / s0](s0 ∈ { hs0 } ∧ w0))
  eleq2i(hs0, { s0 ∈ { hs0 } | w0 }, { s0 |(s0 ∈ { hs0 } ∧ w0)})
  df-rab(s0, { hs0 }, w0)
  df-clab(hs0, s0, (s0 ∈ { hs0 } ∧ w0))
  sban(hs0, s0, s0 ∈ { hs0 }, w0)
  rabn0(s0, { hs0 }, w0)
  spcev(s1, { hs0 }, ({ hs0 } ⊆ c0 ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ { hs0 }, w0)), (s1 ⊆ c0 ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ s1, w0)))
  snex(hs0)
  anbi12d(s1 = { hs0 }, s1 ⊆ c0, ∃(s0 ∈ s1, w0), { hs0 } ⊆ c0, ∃(s0 ∈ { hs0 }, w0))
  sseq1(s1, { hs0 }, c0)
  rexeq(s0, s1, { hs0 }, w0)
  diff.hs0.c({ s0 |(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)})
  diff.hs0.w(∃(s1,(s1 ⊆ c0 ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ s1, w0))))
  diff.wa.s(s1, { hs0 } ⊆ c0, ∃(s0 ∈ { hs0 }, w0))
  diff.wss.s(s1, { hs0 }, c0)
  diff.wrex.s(s1, s0, { hs0 }, w0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.csn.s(s1, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.csn.s(s0, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: opex
blocks.content: An ordered pair of classes is a set. Exercise 7 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 16. (Contributed by NM, 18-Aug-1993.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: otex
blocks.content: An ordered triple of classes is a set. (Contributed by NM, 3-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: elopg
blocks.content: Characterization of the elements of an ordered pair. Closed form of ~ elop . (Contributed by BJ, 22-Jun-2019.) (Avoid depending on this detail.)

blocks.name: elop
blocks.content: Characterization of the elements of an ordered pair. Exercise 3 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 15. (Contributed by NM, 15-Jul-1993.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Apr-2015.) Remove an extraneous hypothesis. (Revised by BJ, 25-Dec-2020.) (Avoid depending on this detail.)

blocks.name: opi1
blocks.content: One of the two elements in an ordered pair. (Contributed by NM, 15-Jul-1993.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Apr-2015.) (Avoid depending on this detail.)

blocks.name: opi2
blocks.content: One of the two elements of an ordered pair. (Contributed by NM, 5-Aug-1993.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Apr-2015.) (Avoid depending on this detail.)

blocks.name: opeluu
blocks.content: Each member of an ordered pair belongs to the union of the union of a class to which the ordered pair belongs. Lemma 3D of [Enderton] p. 41. (Contributed by NM, 31-Mar-1995.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Feb-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm opeluu(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(cop(c0, c1), c2), wa(wcel(c0, cuni(cuni(c2))), wcel(c1, cuni(cuni(c2)))))
  -| wcel(c0, universe)
  -| wcel(c1, universe)
} = {
  jca(wcel(cop(c0, c1), c2), wcel(c0, cuni(cuni(c2))), wcel(c1, cuni(cuni(c2))))
  sylancr(wcel(cop(c0, c1), c2), wcel(c0, cuni(cuni(c2))), wcel(c0, cpr(c0, c1)), wcel(cpr(c0, c1), cuni(c2)))
  prid1(c0, c1)
  elunii(c0, cpr(c0, c1), cuni(c2))
  sylancr(wcel(cop(c0, c1), c2), wcel(c1, cuni(cuni(c2))), wcel(c1, cpr(c0, c1)), wcel(cpr(c0, c1), cuni(c2)))
  prid2(c1, c0)
  mpan(wcel(cop(c0, c1), c2), wcel(cpr(c0, c1), cuni(c2)), wcel(cpr(c0, c1), cop(c0, c1)))
  opi2(c0, c1)
  elunii(cpr(c0, c1), cop(c0, c1), c2)
  elunii(c1, cpr(c0, c1), cuni(c2))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm opeluu(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (< c0, c1 > ∈ c2 →(c0 ∈ ⋃ ⋃ c2 ∧ c1 ∈ ⋃ ⋃ c2))
  ⊣ c0 ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ c1 ∈ 𝕌
} = {
  jca(< c0, c1 > ∈ c2, c0 ∈ ⋃ ⋃ c2, c1 ∈ ⋃ ⋃ c2)
  sylancr(< c0, c1 > ∈ c2, c0 ∈ ⋃ ⋃ c2, c0 ∈ { c0, c1 }, { c0, c1 } ∈ ⋃ c2)
  prid1(c0, c1)
  elunii(c0, { c0, c1 }, ⋃ c2)
  sylancr(< c0, c1 > ∈ c2, c1 ∈ ⋃ ⋃ c2, c1 ∈ { c0, c1 }, { c0, c1 } ∈ ⋃ c2)
  prid2(c1, c0)
  mpan(< c0, c1 > ∈ c2, { c0, c1 } ∈ ⋃ c2, { c0, c1 } ∈ < c0, c1 >)
  opi2(c0, c1)
  elunii({ c0, c1 }, < c0, c1 >, c2)
  elunii(c1, { c0, c1 }, ⋃ c2)
}

blocks.name: op1stb
blocks.content: Extract the first member of an ordered pair. Theorem 73 of [Suppes] p. 42. (See ~ op2ndb to extract the second member, ~ op1sta for an alternate version, and ~ op1st for the preferred version.) (Contributed by NM, 25-Nov-2003.)
blocks.origin:
thm op1stb(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(cint(cint(cop(c0, c1))), c0)
  -| wcel(c0, universe)
  -| wcel(c1, universe)
} = {
  eqtri(cint(cint(cop(c0, c1))), c0, cint(csn(c0)))
  inteqi(cint(cop(c0, c1)), csn(c0))
  eqtri(cint(cop(c0, c1)), csn(c0), cint(cpr(csn(c0), cpr(c0, c1))))
  inteqi(cop(c0, c1), cpr(csn(c0), cpr(c0, c1)))
  dfop(c0, c1)
  eqtri(cint(cpr(csn(c0), cpr(c0, c1))), csn(c0), cin(csn(c0), cpr(c0, c1)))
  intpr(csn(c0), cpr(c0, c1))
  snex(c0)
  prex(c0, c1)
  mpbi(wceq(cin(csn(c0), cpr(c0, c1)), csn(c0)), wss(csn(c0), cpr(c0, c1)))
  snsspr1(c0, c1)
  df-ss(csn(c0), cpr(c0, c1))
  intsn(c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm op1stb(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ⋂ ⋂ < c0, c1 > = c0
  ⊣ c0 ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ c1 ∈ 𝕌
} = {
  eqtri(⋂ ⋂ < c0, c1 >, c0, ⋂ { c0 })
  inteqi(⋂ < c0, c1 >, { c0 })
  eqtri(⋂ < c0, c1 >, { c0 }, ⋂ { { c0 }, { c0, c1 } })
  inteqi(< c0, c1 >, { { c0 }, { c0, c1 } })
  dfop(c0, c1)
  eqtri(⋂ { { c0 }, { c0, c1 } }, { c0 }, ({ c0 } ⋂ { c0, c1 }))
  intpr({ c0 }, { c0, c1 })
  snex(c0)
  prex(c0, c1)
  mpbi(({ c0 } ⋂ { c0, c1 })= { c0 }, { c0 } ⊆ { c0, c1 })
  snsspr1(c0, c1)
  df-ss({ c0 }, { c0, c1 })
  intsn(c0)
}

blocks.name: brv
blocks.content: Two classes are always in relation by ` _V ` . This is simply equivalent to ` <. A , B >. e. _V ` , and does not imply that ` _V ` is a relation: see ~ nrelv . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 11-Apr-2012.)
